verbs.description: civilise (third-person singular simple present civilises, present participle civilising, simple past and past participle civilised)

entries.meaning: To educate or enlighten a person or people to a perceived higher standard of behaviour.
To introduce or impose the standards of one civilisation upon another civilization, group or person, arguably with the intent of achieving a perceived higher standard of behavior.
To bring from a state of savagery to an educated or refined state.
